result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals/Pick n Save listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.    Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A and B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  No contact with any property owned by Pick n Save in Wales.

01:33 PM Defendant Jacob P Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Bryant J Mcfadden.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
